reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this was our third stay at this hotel,each year just gets better in terms of our rooms @ the hotel,this year we stayed in room 28 which i swear had the most comfortable bed ever made,4 spare pillows in room so you can mix & match to find one that suits,resulta perfect nights sleep.A superb continental breakfast set us up for the walk down into the town to cafe felix for a superb coffee,it is an uphill walk back to hotel,but at 63 & 73 we manage it fairly easily,its a long steady slope,meals in the walled city leave a lot to be desired,but we went for the fireworks on bastille day,simply mesmorising & unforgettable,sitting in the grounds of the hotel,an uncrowded marvellous view,marvellous staff,all with a smile.nothing is to much trouble.Well done hotel montmerency.thank you julie & steve for a wonderful christmas present.
reviews.title: most comfy bed ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love this hotel. It was our 4th visit in the last 5 years and it is still as wonderful. This year we went for the magnificent Bastille Day celebrations - a night to remember. It isn't the cheapest place in Carcassonne, but you couldn't find a better location being right outside the walls of La Cite. The spa is a new addition since our last visit which means i'll probably be tempted there out of season too now that there is an indoor pool as well as the beautiful outdoor one. This trip we stayed in room 21 - lovely view from the garden area but as other reviewers have said the room is on the small side but for us and for a few days it is big enough. My parents had room 28 which was bigger and had a fabulous bathroom but no view of La Cite - always a compromise!! The entrance area of the Montmorency has been totally transformed since our last visit and I do think the rooms need a bit of a facelift now too. However, the gardens, pool area and communal areas are beautiful. It is a real hotel, staffed by real people with personality who know how to look after their guests and that's what makes this hotel so special. I have no doubt that I will be back again next year.
reviews.title: Our 4th visit and it just gets better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is in the right place to visit the old cite [5 minutes] or the town [15 minutes]
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is very well situated (just at the entrance of the Cité) and the rooms were perfect for us: right size, very clean, nice bathroom, nice view from the balcony. I wouldn't recommend the breakfast though: service is very slow and food is not at all special. We decided to cancel it the last morning and went into the Cité to have breakfast, that was a good idea... Swimming pool is nice, not very large but there weren't many people in it. Quiet place, even though the road is not far.
reviews.title: Oustanding service..gracious and kind

reviews.text: What a great modern hotel located right by the UNESCO Carcassonnne village. Our room included a walk out terrace from the ground floor, with comfortable outdoor furniture and fruit trees growing beside.
reviews.title: Great location, very nice staff

reviews.text: There was a mix up with our booking, and Nicole did everything possible to deal with our dilemna and came through with flying colours! Hotel staff recommended restaurants and they turned out great!
reviews.title: Outstanding location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Relaxing, peaceful, beautiful location. Staff and facilities are excellent including the luxurious Spa. Nothing is too much trouble here for the guests. One thing we would have liked, would have been cereal and fresh fruit options at breakfast.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Montmorency is situated right at the gates of the walled city in Carcassonne. It couldn't have a better location. The hotel was clean and comfortable. We were pleased. It is a good walk into the new town but very doable.
reviews.title: Very convenient place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our fifth time here and probably the last as it's no longer value for money. Free parking now costs 10 euros. Not sure if free jacuzzis and pool still available or may be replaced by spa? Great location but nearby hotels offer better value.
reviews.title: Getting dearer each year

reviews.text: I stayed for 1 night. I cannot say anything negative. The room was clean, with a lot of space, breakfast was excellent, location gorgeous. The price however, 125 euro for 1 night for a single room was realy too much. If you stay in carcasonne, stay some miles away from the city center.
reviews.title: very good hotel, but very expensive

reviews.text: Hotel Montmorency is in a great location just outside the old walled city. Hotel Montmorency is a building with only rooms, it is associated with Hotel Chateau which is located across the street. The room rates at Hotel Montmorency are much cheaper than Hotel Chateau. Hotel Montmorency has average sized rooms for Europe. The bathrooms are adequate and include a separate toilette. You can get meals across the street at Hotel Chateau but they are overpriced. You are better off having dinner in the old walled city and for breakfast go to the town square in Carcassonne.
reviews.title: Great location neat the walled city

reviews.text: Best hotel experience on our vacation, we booked it due to its location and the fact that it had a 3 person room. We were pleasantly surprised. The terrace with its view was something we really enjoyed after a super hot day by the coast enjoying the cool breeze and a Pernod was heavenly. Room was well appointed, characterful interior design and yet managed to be stylish and functional. Please note that the reception and terrace is across the road.
reviews.title: Great hotel
